definition: Buddhist nun/(often used in phonetic spellings)
woman who looks after small children/(old) female tutor

sentences.english: A rare example of a Feeorin, Nym was orphaned at an early age.
sentences.chinese: 作爲罕見的菲奧林人，尼姆很早就成了孤兒。

sentences.english: The people had been headed from Nimruz to Herat in western Afghanistan as part of a wedding party.
sentences.chinese: 人們從尼姆魯茲到阿富汗西部的赫拉特去參加婚禮。

sentences.english: Nim's environment really should have been a jungle in Africa.
sentences.chinese: 尼姆的生活環境確實應當在非洲的叢林。

sentences.english: Nim and Ardythe had exchanged a few stilted words, but that was all.
sentences.chinese: 尼姆和阿黛絲拘謹地交談了幾句，沒有別的。

sentences.english: We visited Nimes and Arles, i. e. two ancient cities.
sentences.chinese: 我們訪問了尼姆和阿爾勒，是兩個古城。

sentences.english: Mr Ghanem, who's also a former prime minister, was said to be on the island of Djerba.
sentences.chinese: 據說，此前曾經擔任總理的加尼姆已經抵達傑爾巴島。

sentences.english: Marsh goes on to describe his impression of Nim.
sentences.chinese: 馬什在繼續向我們描述他對尼姆的印象。

sentences.english: He did it under the name of Nimrod .
sentences.chinese: 他以尼姆羅德之名做了那件事。

sentences.english: Like the anima, the animus too has a positive aspect.
sentences.chinese: 阿尼姆斯也像阿尼瑪一樣有一個積極的方面。

sentences.english: Louise herself had family ties in Nimes.
sentences.chinese: 路易絲本人在尼姆有親戚。

sentences.english: Such as admin, could come nimda.
He writes under the name of Nimrod.
sentences.chinese: 他用尼姆羅德這個名字寫作。

sentences.english: Nim glared at Paulsen, but contained his anger, saying nothing.
sentences.chinese: 尼姆瞪了波爾森一眼，但卻按住了怒火，一言未發。

sentences.english: Tasneem Mirza has indebt knowledge of the rug industry.
sentences.chinese: 塔斯尼姆米爾扎已經負債而知識的地毯業。

sentences.english: The best was from the neem tree.
sentences.chinese: 最好的是尼姆樹的細枝。

sentences.english: On impulse, Nim turned in, wheeling the Fiat into one of the empty places.
sentences.chinese: 尼姆一時興起就拐了進去把菲亞特推向一個空的地方。

definition: Barth or Barthes (name)/Roland Barthes (1915-1980), French critic and semiotician
Rhone, river of Switzerland and France
